metadata.reason: Low confidence findings and API connectivity issues affected most models
metadata.recommendation: Retain for current research cycle, but archive after final validation
warnings: Five models failed due to API connectivity issues
Limited convergence due to technical issues
metadata.description: Preliminary research output from llama-3.3-70b model, part of weekly research swarm

concepts.name: HMM for Antibody Developability
concepts.description: By analyzing the sequence data using HMMs, we can identify hidden features in the antibody sequences that influence developability and use this information to design and optimize new antibodies with improved developability properties
implementation_steps: Extract k-mer statistics from antibody sequences
Identify hidden states correlated with developability metrics
Validate model predictions on holdout data
potential_challenges: Data sparsity for rare sequence motifs
Model overfitting on limited training data

relationships.description: HMM-identified features can predict aggregation propensity
Hydrophobicity patterns can be detected through HMM analysis
Thermal stability can be predicted from sequence-level hidden features
HMMs analyze antibody sequences to identify hidden features

model_performance.error_summary: API connectivity issues and database constraint violations prevented most models from completing research tasks

research_gaps: Limited convergence due to API issues
Need for additional research on HMM applications in antibody developability
Insufficient data on model-specific insights and divergences
next_steps: Re-run research swarm with fixed infrastructure
Expand semantic mesh with additional findings
